content:
Guillaume Doll\ufffd\ufffd Zakaria Belhachmi Christophe Prudhomme Murielle Torregrossa Christophe Prudhomme Zakaria Belhachmi Murielle Torregrossa Diffuse optical tomography for tumour detection <p><em>Time-resolved diffuse optical tomography</em> aims to reconstruct images for internal parts of a body (diffusive objects owning one or several inclusions, small animals, ...) from its boundary measures.<br /> This poster gives an overview of the experimental setup created by the ICube/IMIS team and the mathematical model used for the reconstruction. Numerical results are obtained using FEEL++, a C++ library for finite element methods.</p> Tomography; Optic; Image; Reconstruction; Time-Resolved; Feel++; feelpp; FEM; DOT; TR-DOT; 2014-06-18
    https://zenodo.org/record/11641/files/IPB2014_dot_poster.png?subformat=icon-90; https://zenodo.org/record/11641/files/IPB2014_dot_poster.pdf;
